analyzed: thams cad kyi gzhung lugs 'dri bar byed na /

analyzed: la la ci zer /

translated: Then, at a later time, a lay brother spoke the Buddha’s praises in accordance with the truth. As soon as the young householder heard this, he asked,

analyzed: sangs rgyas zhes bya ba'i sgra byung ba 'di dag ni /
translated: “These words ‘Buddha’ that have come out

analyzed: sngon ma byung na /
translated: have not come out before.

original: sangs rgyas zhes bya ba de su zhig /
analyzed: sangs rgyas zhes bya ba de su zhig /

analyzed: de nas dge bsnyen des de dang mthun pa'i sangs rgyas kyi bsngags pa brjod de /
translated: Then the lay brother spoke the Buddha’s praises in accordance with the truth.

translated: So the young householder wanted to see the Blessed One.

analyzed: 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te chos mnyan pa'i phyir spyan sngar 'dug go //
translated: Then, having given up everything, he went to where the Blessed One was. When he arrived, he bowed his head at the Blessed One’s feet and sat before him to listen to the Dharma.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de la de dang mthun pa'i chos bstan te /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de la de dang mthun pa'i chos bstan te /
translated: Then the Blessed One taught him the Dharma that was appropriate for him.

analyzed: de thos nas khyim bdag gi bu de bcom ldan 'das la sems dga' bar gyur to //
translated: When he heard it, the householder’s son’s mind became filled with joy toward the Blessed One.

analyzed: de nas khyim bdag gi bu des bcom ldan 'das kyi gtam 'jug rdzogs par rig nas bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa la mngon par bstod cing rjes su yi rang ste bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag 'tshal nas bcom ldan 'das kyi thad nas song ngo // de nas phyi zhig na de sbyin pa gtong ba'i sems skyes la khyim na ni /
translated: Then, when the householder’s son understood that the Blessed One’s discourse was finished, he praised what the Blessed One had said, rejoiced, bowed low until his forehead touched the Blessed One’s feet, and then departed from the Blessed One’s presence.🔽Later, he had the thought to give a gift, but when he looked around his house, he saw that he had nothing at all.

original: ci yang mi bdog par mthong nas de'i blo skyes pa /
analyzed: ci yang mi bdog par mthong nas de'i blo skyes pa /
translated: The thought occurred to him,

original: bdag rgya mtsho chen po'i nang du song la /
analyzed: bdag rgya mtsho chen po'i nang du song la /
translated: “I will go to the great ocean

original: gal te bdag gis lan gcig tsam rin po che'i gling bgrod pa sgrub nus par gyur na yang de lta na bde blag tu sbyin pa dag sbyin zhing bsod nams dag byed nus so snyam nas tshong pa lnga brgya tsam dang lhan cig tu zong khyer te rgya
analyzed: gal te bdag gis lan gcig tsam rin po che'i gling bgrod pa sgrub nus par gyur na yang de lta na bde blag tu sbyin pa dag sbyin zhing bsod nams dag byed nus so snyam nas tshong pa lnga brgya tsam dang lhan cig tu zong khyer te rgya
translated: “If I could make the journey to the island of jewels just one time, I would be able to give gifts easily and make merit.” He took his goods and set out on the great ocean with about five hundred merchants.

original: mtsho chen po'i nang du song nas des rin po che'i gling bgrod pa bsgrubs te phyir 'dzam bu'i gling logs su chas pa las; de dag la rlung mi bzod ba byung nas des gru bo che ri'i gcong rong zhig tu btsangs so //
analyzed: mtsho chen po'i nang du song nas des rin po che'i gling bgrod pa bsgrubs te phyir 'dzam bu'i gling logs su chas pa las; de dag la rlung mi bzod ba byung nas des gru bo che ri'i gcong rong zhig tu btsangs so //
translated: He reached the island of jewels, and on the way back to Jambudvīpa a storm arose. He wrecked his great ship on a rocky shore.

original: de nas rgya mtsho'i dus rlabs phyir log pa dang / tshong pa de dag 'jigs shing @86b skrag ste; bdag cag ni /🔽shi zin no //🔽bdag cag gi srog ni /
analyzed: de nas rgya mtsho'i dus rlabs phyir log pa dang / tshong pa de dag 'jigs shing @86b skrag ste; bdag cag ni / shi zin no // bdag cag gi srog ni /
translated: When the ocean tide turned and receded, the merchants were terrified.🔽“We are dead!

original: med zin no //
analyzed: med zin no //
translated: Our lives are over!

analyzed: da bdag cag la dka' ba byed pa dang / srog phangs pa sbyin pa su yod ces 'dzer to //
translated: Who will now help us and give us our lives back?” they cried.

original: de nas ded dpon gyis smras pa /
analyzed: de nas ded dpon gyis smras pa /
translated: Then the captain said,

original: ma 'jigs shig ma 'jigs shig /🔽sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la skyabs su dengs shig dang / des bdag cag phongs pa dang / dkos thag pa dang / gnod pa dang phrad pa las skyabs mdzad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma 'jigs shig ma 'jigs shig / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la skyabs su dengs shig dang / des bdag cag phongs pa dang / dkos thag pa dang / gnod pa dang phrad pa las skyabs mdzad par 'gyur ro //
translated: “Do not fear, do not fear!

original: zhes byas so //
analyzed: zhes byas so //
translated: Go for refuge to the Buddha, the Blessed One, and he will protect us from this misfortune, this great danger, this great calamity.”

original: de nas de thos ma thag tu tshong pa de dag rnams sangs rgyas la skyabs su song ste /
analyzed: de nas de thos ma thag tu tshong pa de dag rnams sangs rgyas la skyabs su song ste /
translated: Then, as soon as they heard this, the merchants went for refuge to the Buddha.

original: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das kyis ni /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das kyis ni / 'di lta ste /
translated: “Noble one, Blessed One,🔽if there is nothing that the Blessed One does not see,

original: 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba ci yang mi gzigs pa dang / mi mkhyen pa dang / thugs su ma chud pa ma mchis na /
analyzed: 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba ci yang mi gzigs pa dang / mi mkhyen pa dang / thugs su ma chud pa ma mchis na /
translated: does not know, does not understand,

original: kye ma btsun pa /
analyzed: kye ma btsun pa /
translated: then, noble one,

original: bdag cag phongs shing dkos thag la gnod pa dang phrad pa rnams kyi skyabs mdzad du gsol zhes byas so //
analyzed: bdag cag phongs shing dkos thag la gnod pa dang phrad pa rnams kyi skyabs mdzad du gsol zhes byas so //
translated: please protect us from this misfortune, this great danger, this great calamity.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis ci nas gru de rang nyid ri'i gtsong rong de nas phyir log ste rgya mtsho'i 'gram du 'byung bar 'gyur ba de lta bur byin gyis brlabs so //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis ci nas gru de rang nyid ri'i gtsong rong de nas phyir log ste rgya mtsho'i 'gram du 'byung bar 'gyur ba de lta bur byin gyis brlabs so //
translated: Then the Blessed One blessed the boat so that it would return by itself from the mountain gorge to the ocean shore.

original: de nas de dag rgya mtsho chen po'i 'gram du byung nas mthar gyis mnyan du yod par song ste mnyan du yod par rdzas rnams bzhag nas bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der song ste phyin nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te /
analyzed: de nas de dag rgya mtsho chen po'i 'gram du byung nas mthar gyis mnyan du yod par song ste mnyan du yod par rdzas rnams bzhag nas bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der song ste phyin nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te /
translated: Then, having reached the shore of the great ocean, they gradually went to Śrāvastī. Having put down their goods in Śrāvastī, they went to where the Blessed One was. Having arrived, they bowed their heads at the feet of the Blessed One.

original: bcom @87a *// ldan 'das kyi zhabs la 'o byas nas 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: bcom @87a *// ldan 'das kyi zhabs la 'o byas nas 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: They kissed the feet of the Blessed One and said this:

original: bcom ldan 'das ni /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni /
translated: “The Blessed One

original: bdag cag la dka' ba mdzad mdzad pa lags /
analyzed: bdag cag la dka' ba mdzad mdzad pa lags /
translated: has done what is difficult for us.

original: srog phangs pa stsol ba lags so //
analyzed: srog phangs pa stsol ba lags so //
translated: He has given us back our precious lives.”

original: zhes gsol nas chos mnyan pa'i phyir spyan sngar 'khod do //
analyzed: zhes gsol nas chos mnyan pa'i phyir spyan sngar 'khod do //
translated: Having said this, they sat before him to listen to the Dharma.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de rnams kyi bsam pa dang / bag la nyal dang / khams dang / shes pa dang / rang bzhin thugs su chud nas de dang mthun pa'i chos bstan te /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de rnams kyi bsam pa dang / bag la nyal dang / khams dang / shes pa dang / rang bzhin thugs su chud nas de dang mthun pa'i chos bstan te /
translated: Then the Blessed One, knowing their thoughts, dispositions, natures, and inclinations, gave them a discourse on the Dharma that penetrated their faculties.

original: des na ded dpon la sogs pa tshong pa lnga brgya po rnams kyis stan de nyid la 'khod bzhin du 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i ri'i rtse mo mthon po nyi shu ye shes rdo rjes bcom nas rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu mngon sum du byas te /
analyzed: des na ded dpon la sogs pa tshong pa lnga brgya po rnams kyis stan de nyid la 'khod bzhin du 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i ri'i rtse mo mthon po nyi shu ye shes rdo rjes bcom nas rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu mngon sum du byas te /
translated: And so, while they were sitting right there, the five hundred merchants, with the caravan leader at their head, destroyed with the thunderbolt of wisdom the twenty high peaks of the mountain of views concerning the transitory collection, and manifested the resultant state of stream entry right where they sat.

original: de rnams kyis bden pa mthong nas gsol pa /
analyzed: de rnams kyis bden pa mthong nas gsol pa /
translated: Having seen the truths, they said,

original: btsun pa / bdag cag legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la rab tu byung ba dang / bsnyen par rdzogs shing dge slong gi dngos po 'thob tu rung na /
analyzed: btsun pa / bdag cag legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la rab tu byung ba dang / bsnyen par rdzogs shing dge slong gi dngos po 'thob tu rung na /
translated: “Lord, if permitted we wish to go forth in the Dharma and Vinaya so well spoken, complete the monastic training, and achieve full ordination.

original: bdag cag kyang bcom ldan 'das kyi thad du tshangs par spyod pa spyad par 'tshal lo //
analyzed: bdag cag kyang bcom ldan 'das kyi thad du tshangs par spyod pa spyad par 'tshal lo //
translated: We wish to practice the holy life in the Blessed One’s presence.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de dag dge slong tshur shog ces bya ba'i tshigs gis rab tu phyung ste bsnyen par rdzogs par mdzad nas de dag la lung yang phog ste /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de dag dge slong tshur shog ces bya ba'i tshigs gis rab tu phyung ste bsnyen par rdzogs par mdzad nas de dag la lung yang phog ste /
translated: Then the Blessed One gave them the going forth with the words “Come, monk,” and they were fully ordained.

original: de dag gis kyang brtson pa dang / sgrub pa dang / 'bad pas nyon mongs @87b la thams cad spangs nas dgra bcom pa nyid mngon sum du byas te /
analyzed: de dag gis kyang brtson pa dang / sgrub pa dang / 'bad pas nyon mongs @87b la thams cad spangs nas dgra bcom pa nyid mngon sum du byas te /
translated: They too, through diligence, practice, and effort, abandoned all the defilements and actualized the state of an arhat.

original: de dag dgra bcom pa khams gsum pa'i 'dod chags dang bral bar gyur nas gser dang bong bar mnyam pa; nam mkha' dang lag mthil du 'dra ba'i sems dang ldan pa /
analyzed: de dag dgra bcom pa khams gsum pa'i 'dod chags dang bral bar gyur nas gser dang bong bar mnyam pa; nam mkha' dang lag mthil du 'dra ba'i sems dang ldan pa /
translated: They became arhats, free from the attachments of the three realms, their minds liberated like gold refined a hundred times.

original: tsandan spangs pa lta bur bsil bar gyur pa /
analyzed: tsandan spangs pa lta bur bsil bar gyur pa /
translated: They became cool like sandalwood,

original: rig pas sgo nga'i spubs bcom pa /
analyzed: rig pas sgo nga'i spubs bcom pa /
translated: their insight destroying the eggshell of ignorance.

original: rig pa dang mngon par shes pa dang so so yang dag par rig pa thob pa /
analyzed: rig pa dang mngon par shes pa dang so so yang dag par rig pa thob pa /
translated: They attained knowledge, clairvoyance, and discriminating wisdom.

original: srid pa'i rnyed pa dang chags pa dang bkur sti la mi lta ba /
analyzed: srid pa'i rnyed pa dang chags pa dang bkur sti la mi lta ba /
translated: They were unattached to worldly gain, desire, and praise.

original: dbang po dang nye dbang dang bcas pa'i lha rnams kyis mchod cing rjed pa dang gus par smra ba'i gnas su gyur to //
analyzed: dbang po dang nye dbang dang bcas pa'i lha rnams kyis mchod cing rjed pa dang gus par smra ba'i gnas su gyur to //

analyzed: gtsug lag khang 'ba' zhig tu 'gro 'dod par gyur to //

original: dgra bcom par gyur nas bsam pa /
analyzed: dgra bcom par gyur nas bsam pa /

analyzed: // de nas de mthong ma thag tu pha ma gnyis de la shin tu dga' bar gyur to //

original: des na pha ma de gnyis 'khor dang bcas pas stan de dag nyid la 'khod bzhin du 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i ri'i rtse mo mthon po nyi shu ye shes rdo rjes bcom nas rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu mngon sum du byas te /
analyzed: des na pha ma de gnyis 'khor dang bcas pas stan de dag nyid la 'khod bzhin du 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i ri'i rtse mo mthon po nyi shu ye shes rdo rjes bcom nas rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu mngon sum du byas te /
translated: Then, while still sitting on their seats, the parents and their retinue destroyed with the thunderbolt of wisdom the twenty high peaks of the mountain of views concerning the perishables, and manifested the resultant state of stream-entry right where they sat.

original: bden pa mthong nas skyabs su 'gro ba dang / bslab pa'i gzhi rnams la bkod de /
analyzed: bden pa mthong nas skyabs su 'gro ba dang / bslab pa'i gzhi rnams la bkod de /
translated: Having seen the truths, they were established in the refuges and in the foundations of the trainings.

original: sbyin pa dag sbyin pa'i bgo sha yang byed du bcug nas khyim de khron pa dang 'dra bar byas te bzhag go /
analyzed: sbyin pa dag sbyin pa'i bgo sha yang byed du bcug nas khyim de khron pa dang 'dra bar byas te bzhag go /
translated: They were made to share in the giving of gifts, and the house was made like a well.

original: des ne'u ldangs kyi grogs po lnga brgya bo de dag kyang skyabs su 'gro ba dang / bslab pa'i gzhi rnams la bkod do //
analyzed: des ne'u ldangs kyi grogs po lnga brgya bo de dag kyang skyabs su 'gro ba dang / bslab pa'i gzhi rnams la bkod do //
translated: The five hundred young men who were their friends were also established in the refuges and in the foundations of the trainings.

original: de nas dge slong rnams kyis sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa /
analyzed: de nas dge slong rnams kyis sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa /
translated: Then the monks requested the Blessed Buddha,

original: btsun pa / khyim bdag 'dis las ci bgyis na /
analyzed: btsun pa / khyim bdag 'dis las ci bgyis na /
translated: “Lord, what action did this householder take

original: las de'i rnam par smin pas phyug cing nor mang la longs spyod che ba'i rigs su skyes la /
analyzed: las de'i rnam par smin pas phyug cing nor mang la longs spyod che ba'i rigs su skyes la /
translated: As the result of that action, he was born into a family that was rich, had much wealth, and great resources.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyang 'dis mnyes par bgyis te @91a *//
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyang 'dis mnyes par bgyis te @91a *//
translated: He pleased the Blessed One,

analyzed: mi mnyes par ma bgyis nas bcom ldan 'das kyi bstan pa la rab tu byung ste nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs nas dgra bcom pa nyid mngon sum du bya bgyis la /
translated: and did not displease him. He went forth in the doctrine of the Blessed One, cast away all afflictive emotions, and manifested arhatship.

original: 'di nyid la brten nas pha ma la sogs pa dang / ne'u ldangs kyi grogs po lnga brgyas bden pa mthong bar gyur te /
analyzed: 'di nyid la brten nas pha ma la sogs pa dang / ne'u ldangs kyi grogs po lnga brgyas bden pa mthong bar gyur te /
translated: And it is on the basis of him that his parents and so on and his five hundred young friends came to see the truths.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyang 'dis mnyes par bgyis te mi mnyes par ma bgyis lags /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyang 'dis mnyes par bgyis te mi mnyes par ma bgyis lags /
translated: He pleased the Blessed One, and did not displease him.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: smon lam gyi dbang las gyur to //
analyzed: smon lam gyi dbang las gyur to //
translated: “It is due to the power of their aspirations.”

original: gsol pa / btsun pa /
analyzed: gsol pa / btsun pa /
translated: “Lord,

original: 'di rnams kyis smon lam gang du btab lags /
analyzed: 'di rnams kyis smon lam gang du btab lags /
translated: where did they make their aspirations?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: dge slong dag /
analyzed: dge slong dag /
translated: “Monks,

original: sngon byung ba 'das pa'i dus na bskal pa bzang po 'di nyid la skye rgu'i tshe lo nyi khri thub pa na yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rig pa dang zhabs su ldan pa /🔽bde bar gshegs pa /🔽'jig rten mkhyen pa /🔽skyes bu 'dul bya'i kha lo sgyur ba bla na med pa /
analyzed: sngon byung ba 'das pa'i dus na bskal pa bzang po 'di nyid la skye rgu'i tshe lo nyi khri thub pa na yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rig pa dang zhabs su ldan pa / bde bar gshegs pa / 'jig rten mkhyen pa / skyes bu 'dul bya'i kha lo sgyur ba bla na med pa /
translated: In the past, in this fortunate eon, when the lifespan of living beings was twenty thousand years, there was a perfect buddha called Vipaśyin, who was learned and virtuous,🔽a blissful one,🔽a knower of the world,🔽an unsurpassed charioteer of those who need taming,

original: lha dang mi rnams kyi ston pa /🔽sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das 'od srung zhes bya ba 'jig rten du byung ste /
analyzed: lha dang mi rnams kyi ston pa / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das 'od srung zhes bya ba 'jig rten du byung ste /
translated: “Monks, in the past, in this fortunate eon, when people lived as long as twenty thousand years and the totally and completely awakened buddha possessed of insight and perfect conduct, the sugata, the knower of the world, the tamer of persons, the charioteer, the unsurpassed guide, the teacher of gods and humans, the blessed buddha known as Kāśyapa was in the world,

original: de'i tshe grong khyer w'a ra na si na khyim bdag cig gnas pa las /
analyzed: de'i tshe grong khyer w'a ra na si na khyim bdag cig gnas pa las /
translated: “At that time there lived in the city of Vārāṇasī a certain householder.

original: phyi zhig na de'i bu gzugs bzang zhing blta na sdug la mdzes pa zhig btsas te /
analyzed: phyi zhig na de'i bu gzugs bzang zhing blta na sdug la mdzes pa zhig btsas te /
translated: One day a son was born to him who was well proportioned, pleasing to the eye, and beautiful.

original: de gang gi tshe cher skyes pa de'i tshe des yang @91b dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas 'od srung gi bstan pa la dad pa rnyed nas skyabs su 'gro ba dang / bslab pa'i gzhi rnams blangs so //
analyzed: de gang gi tshe cher skyes pa de'i tshe des yang @91b dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas 'od srung gi bstan pa la dad pa rnyed nas skyabs su 'gro ba dang / bslab pa'i gzhi rnams blangs so //
translated: When he grew up, he found faith in the doctrine of the totally and completely awakened Buddha Kāśyapa, went for refuge, and took the fundamental precepts.

original: de gang gi nyin bar btsas pa de kho na'i nyin par khyim bdag gzhan gyi bu lnga brgya yang btsas te /
analyzed: de gang gi nyin bar btsas pa de kho na'i nyin par khyim bdag gzhan gyi bu lnga brgya yang btsas te /
translated: On the very day he was born, five hundred sons were born to other householders.

original: gang gi tshe de dag cher skyes pa de'i tshe brtag pa rnam pa brgyad la byang bar gyur to //
analyzed: gang gi tshe de dag cher skyes pa de'i tshe brtag pa rnam pa brgyad la byang bar gyur to //
translated: When they grew up, they became skilled in the eight kinds of analysis.

original: de nas de dag so so'i pha ma rnams kyis mdza' sde'i nang du btang ngo //
analyzed: de nas de dag so so'i pha ma rnams kyis mdza' sde'i nang du btang ngo //
translated: Then their respective parents sent them to the group of friends.

original: de nas phyi zhig na dpyid kyi dus su mdza' sde bo de rnams skyed mos tshal shing ljon pa yal ga 'khrigs shing me tog rgyas pa'i nang du 'gro 'dod par gyur nas ne'u bla rnams kyis khye'u de sngon du gtang bar 'dod de /🔽khyod sngar song la bza' ba dang / bca' ba dag sta gon gyis shig dang / bdag cag kyang don dag grub nas 'ong ngo //
analyzed: de nas phyi zhig na dpyid kyi dus su mdza' sde bo de rnams skyed mos tshal shing ljon pa yal ga 'khrigs shing me tog rgyas pa'i nang du 'gro 'dod par gyur nas ne'u bla rnams kyis khye'u de sngon du gtang bar 'dod de / khyod sngar song la bza' ba dang / bca' ba dag sta gon gyis shig dang / bdag cag kyang don dag grub nas 'ong ngo //
translated: One day in the spring, the group of friends wanted to go to a pleasure grove with dense tree branches and blooming flowers. The sons of the Śākya clan wanted to send the young man ahead.🔽“You go first and prepare the food and drink,

original: zhes byas so //
analyzed: zhes byas so //
translated: and we will come when we have finished our business.”

original: de nas de der song nas bza' ba dang / bca' ba gtsang ma bzang po mang po dag sta gon byas so //
analyzed: de nas de der song nas bza' ba dang / bca' ba gtsang ma bzang po mang po dag sta gon byas so //
translated: He went there and prepared a lot of good, fresh food.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas 'od srung 'khor dang bcas pa yang sa phyogs de logs nas w'a ra na sir bsod snyoms la chas te gshegs so //
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas 'od srung 'khor dang bcas pa yang sa phyogs de logs nas w'a ra na sir bsod snyoms la chas te gshegs so //
translated: The Completely Enlightened One Kāśyapa, together with his retinue, was also traveling to Vārāṇasī for alms.

original: de nas khye'u des thag ring po zhig nas yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas 'od srung 'khor dang bcas pa mthong ngo //
analyzed: de nas khye'u des thag ring po zhig nas yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas 'od srung 'khor dang bcas pa mthong ngo //
translated: The young man saw the Completely Enlightened One Kāśyapa, together with his retinue, from a distance.

original: mthong nas kyang des bsam pa /🔽yon gnas kyi mchog 'di lta bu bsod @92a *//
analyzed: mthong nas kyang des bsam pa / yon gnas kyi mchog 'di lta bu bsod @92a *//
translated: When he saw him, he thought,

original: snyoms la chas te gshegs la /
analyzed: snyoms la chas te gshegs la /
translated: “This supreme recipient of offerings is traveling for alms.

original: bdag gis kyang tshegs chung ngus bza' ba dang bca' ba dag sbyar ba yod na /
analyzed: bdag gis kyang tshegs chung ngus bza' ba dang bca' ba dag sbyar ba yod na /
translated: I have prepared food and drink with little difficulty.

original: bdag gis je yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas 'od srung 'khor dang bcas pa la bshos gsol la de'i 'og tu bdag gis grogs po rnams kyi bza' ba dang / bca' ba gzhan dag sbyar bar bya'o snyam nas des yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas 'od srung 'khor dang bcas pa skyed mos tshal de nyid kyi nang du spyan drangs te bza' ba dang bca' ba gtsang ma bzang pos tshim par byas te ci bzhed pa bstabs
analyzed: bdag gis je yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas 'od srung 'khor dang bcas pa la bshos gsol la de'i 'og tu bdag gis grogs po rnams kyi bza' ba dang / bca' ba gzhan dag sbyar bar bya'o snyam nas des yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas 'od srung 'khor dang bcas pa skyed mos tshal de nyid kyi nang du spyan drangs te bza' ba dang bca' ba gtsang ma bzang pos tshim par byas te ci bzhed pa bstabs
translated: I will offer a meal to the totally and completely awakened Buddha Kāśyapa and his assembly, and afterward I will prepare other food and drink for my friends.” He invited the totally and completely awakened Buddha Kāśyapa and his saṅgha of disciples to the park, and with his own hands he served and satisfied them with many good, wholesome foods, offering all that they wished.

original: nas chos mnyan pa'i phyir spyan sngar 'dug go /
analyzed: nas chos mnyan pa'i phyir spyan sngar 'dug go /
translated: After they had finished eating, he sat before the Blessed One to listen to the Dharma.

original: de nas yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas 'od srung gis de la chos kyi gtam gyis yang dag par bstan /🔽yang dag par 'dzin du bcug /
analyzed: de nas yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas 'od srung gis de la chos kyi gtam gyis yang dag par bstan / yang dag par 'dzin du bcug /
translated: The totally and completely awakened Buddha Kāśyapa then taught him the Dharma,🔽encouraging him,

original: yang dag par gzengs bstod /
analyzed: yang dag par gzengs bstod /
translated: benefiting him,

original: yang dag par dga' bar mdzad nas gdan las bzhengs te gshegs so //
analyzed: yang dag par dga' bar mdzad nas gdan las bzhengs te gshegs so //
translated: and delighting him. Then he rose from his seat and departed.

original: de nas khye'u des mdza' sde bo rnams kyi phyir bza' ba dang / bca' ba gzhan dag sta gon byed pa la zhugs so //
analyzed: de nas khye'u des mdza' sde bo rnams kyi phyir bza' ba dang / bca' ba gzhan dag sta gon byed pa la zhugs so //
translated: Then the young man prepared other food and drink for his friends.

original: de nas mdza' sde bo de rnams skyed mos tshal der lhags nas bdag cag gi bza' ba dang / bca' ba sta gon byas pa de dag thams cad yang dag par rdzogs pa'i @92b sangs rgyas 'od srung 'khor dang bcas pa la phul lo //
analyzed: de nas mdza' sde bo de rnams skyed mos tshal der lhags nas bdag cag gi bza' ba dang / bca' ba sta gon byas pa de dag thams cad yang dag par rdzogs pa'i @92b sangs rgyas 'od srung 'khor dang bcas pa la phul lo //
translated: Then the friends arrived at the park and offered all the food and drink they had prepared to the Completely Awakened One Kāśyapa and his retinue.

original: zhes thos so //
analyzed: zhes thos so //
translated: They heard this.

original: de thos ma thag tu de dag shas cher khros te /
analyzed: de thos ma thag tu de dag shas cher khros te /
translated: As soon as they heard it, they became very angry.

original: de dag khros nas khye'u de gsad par byas so //
analyzed: de dag khros nas khye'u de gsad par byas so //
translated: In their anger, they were about to kill the young man.

analyzed: de nas khye'u de 'jigs shing skrag par gyur nas drang srong smra bar song ste /
translated: Then the young man, frightened and terrified, went to Ṛṣivadana.

original: des gnas de nas pha ma gnyis la bzlugs te pha ma gnyis kyis 'thab mo zhi bar bya bar brtsam pa las zhi bar byed ma nus nas khye'u des pha ma gnyis la gsol te yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas 'od srung gi gsung rab la rab🔽tu byung ngo //
analyzed: des gnas de nas pha ma gnyis la bzlugs te pha ma gnyis kyis 'thab mo zhi bar bya bar brtsam pa las zhi bar byed ma nus nas khye'u des pha ma gnyis la gsol te yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas 'od srung gi gsung rab la rab tu byung ngo //
translated: The young man then asked his parents for permission to go forth in the doctrine of the totally and completely awakened Buddha Kāśyapa.

original: de rab tu byung nas sde snod gsum lobs te /
analyzed: de rab tu byung nas sde snod gsum lobs te /
translated: “After going forth, he mastered the Tripiṭaka

original: rig pa dang grol ba'i spobs pa dang ldan pa'i chos smra bar gyur nas des pha ma gnyis skyabs su 'gro ba dang / bslab pa'i gzhi rnams la bkod nas sbyin pa dag spyin pa'i bgo bsha' byed du bcug go /
analyzed: rig pa dang grol ba'i spobs pa dang ldan pa'i chos smra bar gyur nas des pha ma gnyis skyabs su 'gro ba dang / bslab pa'i gzhi rnams la bkod nas sbyin pa dag spyin pa'i bgo bsha' byed du bcug go /
translated: and became a proponent of the Dharma with eloquence born of knowledge and freedom. He established his parents in the refuges and precepts, and he had them practice generosity and share what they had.

original: de nas mdza' sde bo rnams kyis de rab tu byung ba mthong nas 'gyod pa skyes te bdag cag gis ma legs par byas so snyam nas de dag gis de'i rkang pa la phyag 'tshal te bzod pa gsol to //
analyzed: de nas mdza' sde bo rnams kyis de rab tu byung ba mthong nas 'gyod pa skyes te bdag cag gis ma legs par byas so snyam nas de dag gis de'i rkang pa la phyag 'tshal te bzod pa gsol to //
translated: “When the members of the community saw that he had gone forth, they regretted it, thinking, ‘We have done wrong.’ They bowed down at his feet and asked his forgiveness.

original: de las skyabs su 'gro ba dang / bslab pa'i gzhi rnams kyang blangs so //
analyzed: de las skyabs su 'gro ba dang / bslab pa'i gzhi rnams kyang blangs so //
translated: He took refuge and the fundamental precepts.

original: de nas phyi zhig na dge slong de nad kyis thebs nas de rtsa ba dang / sdong bu dang / lo ma dang / me tog dang / 'bras bu'i sman rnams kyis rim gro byas kyang sos par byed ma nus te /🔽des 'chi @93a *//
analyzed: de nas phyi zhig na dge slong de nad kyis thebs nas de rtsa ba dang / sdong bu dang / lo ma dang / me tog dang / 'bras bu'i sman rnams kyis rim gro byas kyang sos par byed ma nus te / des 'chi @93a *//
translated: Later, that monk became ill. Although he was treated with medicinal roots, stalks, leaves, flowers, and fruits, he was not cured.

original: khar smon lam btab pa /
analyzed: khar smon lam btab pa /
translated: At the time of his death, he prayed,

original: kye ma 'di ltar bdag gis yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas 'od srung gi bstan pa la tshe gcig tu tshangs par spyod pa spyad kyang yon tan gyi tshogs ci yang ma thob na /
analyzed: kye ma 'di ltar bdag gis yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas 'od srung gi bstan pa la tshe gcig tu tshangs par spyod pa spyad kyang yon tan gyi tshogs ci yang ma thob na /
translated: “Alas! Although I practiced pure conduct all my life in the doctrine of the totally and completely awakened Buddha Kāśyapa, I did not attain any great virtues.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis bdag gang dang gang du skye bar 'gyur ba de dang der phyug cing nor mang la longs spyod che ba'i rigs su skye bar shog cig /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis bdag gang dang gang du skye bar 'gyur ba de dang der phyug cing nor mang la longs spyod che ba'i rigs su skye bar shog cig /
translated: So by this root of virtue, wherever I am born, may it be into a family of great means, prosperity, and wealth.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas 'od srung gis bram ze'i khye'u bla ma lung bstan pa gang yin pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de bdag gis mnyes par byed par gyur cig /🔽mi mnyes par byed par ma gyur cig /
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas 'od srung gis bram ze'i khye'u bla ma lung bstan pa gang yin pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de bdag gis mnyes par byed par gyur cig / mi mnyes par byed par ma gyur cig /
translated: May I please and not displease Uttara, the young brahmin prophesied by the totally and completely awakened Buddha Kāśyapa to be the next blessed buddha.

original: de kho na'i bstan pa rab tu byung nas nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs te dgra bcom pa nyid mngon sum du byed par gyur cig ces byas so //
analyzed: de kho na'i bstan pa rab tu byung nas nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs te dgra bcom pa nyid mngon sum du byed par gyur cig ces byas so //
translated: May I go forth in his doctrine alone, cast away all afflictive emotions, and manifest arhatship.’

original: de'i pha ma gnyis dang mdza' sde bo de rnams kyang de'i mdun du 'dug par gyur te /
analyzed: de'i pha ma gnyis dang mdza' sde bo de rnams kyang de'i mdun du 'dug par gyur te /
translated: His parents and his friends sat before him,

original: de rnams kyis kyang thos nas smon lam btab pa /🔽bdag cag kyang khyod kho na la brten te sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de mnyes par byed par gyur cig /
analyzed: de rnams kyis kyang thos nas smon lam btab pa / bdag cag kyang khyod kho na la brten te sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de mnyes par byed par gyur cig /
translated: and when they heard his aspiration, they made the same aspiration.

original: mi mnyes pa byed par ma gyur cig ces byas so //🔽dge slong dag /
analyzed: mi mnyes pa byed par ma gyur cig ces byas so // dge slong dag /
translated: ‘May we too, relying on you alone, please and not displease Uttara, the young brahmin prophesied by the totally and completely awakened Buddha Kāśyapa to be the next blessed buddha.🔽May we go forth in his doctrine alone, cast away all afflictive emotions, and manifest arhatship.’

original: ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: ji snyam du sems /
translated: “Monks, what do you think?

original: de'i tshe sde snod gsum par gyur pa gang yin pa de ni khyim bdag gi bu 'di kho na yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe sde snod gsum par gyur pa gang yin pa de ni khyim bdag gi bu 'di kho na yin no //
translated: The one who was the Tripiṭaka master then is none other than this householder’s son.

original: de'i tshe pha ma gnyis @93b su gyur pa gang yin pa de gnyis ni da lta'i pha ma gnyis kho na yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe pha ma gnyis @93b su gyur pa gang yin pa de gnyis ni da lta'i pha ma gnyis kho na yin no //
translated: The ones who were his parents then are none other than his parents now.

original: de'i tshe mdza' sde bor gyur pa gang yin pa de dag ni da ltar gyi ne'u ldang lnga brgya po 'di dag kho na yin no //🔽des der tshe gcig tu tshangs par spyod pa spyad nas 'chi khar smon lam btab pa'i las de'i rnam par smin pas gang dang gang du skyes pa de dang der phyug cing nor mang la longs spyod che ba'i rigs su skyes te /
analyzed: de'i tshe mdza' sde bor gyur pa gang yin pa de dag ni da ltar gyi ne'u ldang lnga brgya po 'di dag kho na yin no // des der tshe gcig tu tshangs par spyod pa spyad nas 'chi khar smon lam btab pa'i las de'i rnam par smin pas gang dang gang du skyes pa de dang der phyug cing nor mang la longs spyod che ba'i rigs su skyes te /
translated: The ones who were his friends then are none other than these five hundred hunters now.

original: dge slong dag /
analyzed: dge slong dag /
translated: “Monks,

original: nga yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas 'od srung dang shin tu mnyam pa dang / shugs mnyam pa dang / mdzad pa mnyam pa dang / thabs mnyam pa brnyes par gyur nas 'dis nga mnyes par byas te mi mnyes par ma byas la /
analyzed: nga yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas 'od srung dang shin tu mnyam pa dang / shugs mnyam pa dang / mdzad pa mnyam pa dang / thabs mnyam pa brnyes par gyur nas 'dis nga mnyes par byas te mi mnyes par ma byas la /
translated: He pleased me, he did not displease me.

original: nga nyid kyi bstan pa la rab tu byung ste nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs nas dgra bcom pa nyid mngon sum du byas so //
analyzed: nga nyid kyi bstan pa la rab tu byung ste nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs nas dgra bcom pa nyid mngon sum du byas so //
translated: He went forth in my very doctrine, cast away all afflictive emotions, and manifested arhatship.

original: der de'i pha ma gnyis dang / mdza' sde bo de rnams kyis kyang smon lam btab pa des na /
analyzed: der de'i pha ma gnyis dang / mdza' sde bo de rnams kyis kyang smon lam btab pa des na /

analyzed: btsun pa / bcom ldan 'das kyis klu ma rungs pa dga' bo dang / nye dga' la sogs pa yang btul /
translated: Venerable One, the Blessed One has subdued the evil nāgas Nanda, Upananda, and others,

analyzed: gnod sbyin ma rungs pa 'brog gnas la sogs pa yang btul na /

original: yul ma ga dha dang / yul ko sa la gnyis kyi bar mtshams na sha za'i tshogs chen po gnas te /
analyzed: yul ma ga dha dang / yul ko sa la gnyis kyi bar mtshams na sha za'i tshogs chen po gnas te /

analyzed: de dag de na 'khod pas skye bo mang po la gnod pa bgyid na /
translated: and because they dwell there, they harm many people.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis sha za'i tshogs de dag la thugs brtse ba'i slad du gdul bar gsol /🔽de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis rgyal po gzugs can snying po la cang mi gsung bas gnang ngo //

translated: Therefore, I request the Blessed One to tame that assembly of piśācas out of compassion.🔽Then the Blessed One assented to King Bimbisāra by remaining silent.

original: @111b de nas rgyal po gzugs can snying pos bcom ldan 'das kyis cang mi gsung bas gnang bar rig nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te bcom ldan 'das kyi thad nas song ngo //
analyzed: @111b de nas rgyal po gzugs can snying pos bcom ldan 'das kyis cang mi gsung bas gnang bar rig nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te bcom ldan 'das kyi thad nas song ngo //
translated: Then, knowing that the Blessed One had assented by remaining silent, King Bimbisāra bowed his head at the Blessed One's feet and left the Blessed One's presence.

analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis sha za de rnams gdul ba'i dus la bab par gzigs nas rgyal po'i khab nas mi snang bar gyur te s'a la'i nags khung sha za rnams kyi 'dabs su gshegs so //
translated: Then the Blessed One saw that the time had come to tame those rākṣasas. He disappeared from Rājagṛha and went to the Sālavana forest, to the edge of the rākṣasas' territory.

original: de rnams kyis thag ring po zhig nas bcom ldan 'das mthong ngo //
analyzed: de rnams kyis thag ring po zhig nas bcom ldan 'das mthong ngo //

analyzed: mthong nas kyang gzugs mi sdug par bsgyur te shugs chen pos bcom ldan 'das kyi thog tu brgyugs so //
translated: Having seen him, they transformed their bodies into ugly forms and rushed with great force toward the Blessed One.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis 'jig rten pa'i thugs bskyed de /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis 'jig rten pa'i thugs bskyed de /
translated: Then the Blessed One generated a worldly thought:🔽Oh, it would be good if Vaiśravaṇa, the great king, together with all the famous yakṣas, came to see me.

original: kye ma rgyal po chen po rnam thos kyi bu gnod sbyin che bar grags so cog dang lhan cig tu nga la blta ba'i phyir 'ongs na legs so snyam du dgongs nas bcom ldan 'das kyis thugs bskyed ma thag tu rgyal po chen po rnam thos kyi bu
analyzed: kye ma rgyal po chen po rnam thos kyi bu gnod sbyin che bar grags so cog dang lhan cig tu nga la blta ba'i phyir 'ongs na legs so snyam du dgongs nas bcom ldan 'das kyis thugs bskyed ma thag tu rgyal po chen po rnam thos kyi bu
translated: As soon as the Blessed One generated that thought, Vaiśravaṇa, the great king,

original: gnod sbyin che bar grags so cog dang lhan cig tu bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der dong ste lhags nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te phyogs gcig tu 'khod do //

translated: together with all the famous great yakṣas, went to where the Blessed One was, and having arrived, they bowed their heads at the feet of the Blessed One and sat to one side.

original: de nas rgyal po chen po rnam thos kyi bu dang / gnod sbyin che bar grags so cog gzhan dag gis sha za'i tshogs rnams gtses nas de dag 'jigs shing skrag ste phan tshun du 'byer bar brtsams pa @112a *//
analyzed: de nas rgyal po chen po rnam thos kyi bu dang / gnod sbyin che bar grags so cog gzhan dag gis sha za'i tshogs rnams gtses nas de dag 'jigs shing skrag ste phan tshun du 'byer bar brtsams pa @112a *//
translated: Then the great king Vaiśravaṇa and the other famous great yakṣas tormented the hordes of piśācas, and they, frightened and terrified, began to scatter in all directions.

original: las; bcom ldan 'das kyis de dag gdul ba'i phyir kho ra khor yug nas me chen po sprul nas de dag gis bdag cag nyid me chen pos 'khor bar mthong ste 'bros kyang ma nus nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs drung 'ba' zhig zhi bar mthong ste skyabs
analyzed: las; bcom ldan 'das kyis de dag gdul ba'i phyir kho ra khor yug nas me chen po sprul nas de dag gis bdag cag nyid me chen pos 'khor bar mthong ste 'bros kyang ma nus nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs drung 'ba' zhig zhi bar mthong ste skyabs
translated: But the Blessed One, in order to tame them, emanated a great fire all around, and they saw themselves surrounded by a great fire. Although they tried to escape, they were unable to, and they saw that only in the presence of the feet of the Blessed One was there peace.

original: tshol zhing bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der dong ste lhags nas bcom ldan 'das la bskor te 'khod do //
analyzed: tshol zhing bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der dong ste lhags nas bcom ldan 'das la bskor te 'khod do //
translated: They went to the Blessed One, circumambulated him, and sat down.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis sha za de rnams la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis sha za de rnams la bka' stsal pa /

analyzed: khyed sngon gyi sdig pa mi dge ba'i las kyis sha za'i skye gnas dma' bar skyes la /
translated: “Due to your previous sinful and nonvirtuous actions, you have been born in the lowly state of a piśāca.

analyzed: da ltar yang khyed skye bo mang po la gnod par byed na /

analyzed: 'di nas shi 'phos na khyed kyi 'gro ba ni / cir 'gyur / skye gnas ni /

original: ci yin / 'gro ba'i sa ni /
analyzed: ci yin / 'gro ba'i sa ni /

original: gang yin / de dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: gang yin / de dag gis smras pa /

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bdag cag la bka' ci stsal /

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /

analyzed: da phyin chad sdig pa'i las 'or la /

analyzed: skyabs su 'gro ba dang / bslab pa'i gzhi rnams zungs shig /
translated: Take refuge and observe the fundamental precepts.”

original: sha za rnams kyis gsol pa /
analyzed: sha za rnams kyis gsol pa /

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bdag cag la bka' ji skad stsal pa de bzhin du 'tshal lo //

analyzed: zhes gsol nas sha za de rnams kyis skyabs su 'gro ba dang / bslab pa'i gzhi rnams blangs te de phyin chad sdig pa'i las spangs so //

analyzed: sha za de rnams kyang bla na med pa'i lam la gnas par gyur nas phan tshun 'drul ba rnams la chu sbyin par byed do //

analyzed: kha zas kyang sbyin par byed do //

original: lam stor ba rnams la yang lam ston par byed do; ;de nas yul ka shi dang yul ko sa la'i mi rnams ngo mtshar du gyur te bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di ltar gdul dka' ba 'di dag btul lo //
analyzed: lam stor ba rnams la yang lam ston par byed do; ;de nas yul ka shi dang yul ko sa la'i mi rnams ngo mtshar du gyur te bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di ltar gdul dka' ba 'di dag btul lo //
translated: Then the people of Kāśi and Kośala were amazed, thinking, “The Blessed One has tamed these who were so difficult to tame.”

original: zhes 'dzer to //
analyzed: zhes 'dzer to //
translated: So they said.

original: de nas dge slong rnams kyis sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa /
analyzed: de nas dge slong rnams kyis sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa /
translated: Then the monks said to the Buddha, the Blessed One,

analyzed: btsun pa / bcom ldan 'das kyis sha za 'di dag kyang btul te skyabs su 'gro ba dang / bslab pa'i gzhi rnams 'dzin du stsal /

analyzed: skye bo phal po che la yang sman yon btags pa la gzigs /

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /

analyzed: 'das pa'i dus na yang ngas 'di rnams sdig pa'i las las bzlog ste /

analyzed: ji ltar dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la bkod pa de nyon cig /

analyzed: thub kyi gnas shig na drang srong zhig gnas te /

translated: In order to subdue those flesh-eating spirits, the people asked the sage to help them. The sage subdued those flesh-eating spirits and established them in the ten virtuous actions.

analyzed: dge slong dag /
translated: “Monks,

analyzed: sha za 'di dag kho na yin te /

analyzed: de'i tshe yang ngas 'di dag btul te dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la bkod do //

analyzed: da ltar yang ngas 'di dag sdig pa'i las las bzlog ste dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la bkod do ////
translated: Now, too, I have turned them away from evil actions and established them in the ten virtuous actions.”

original: las brgya tham pa /
analyzed: las brgya tham pa /

original: bam po sum cu gsum pa /

analyzed: thos nas kyang g-yul dgyed pa'i phyir 'khor lnga brgya dang bcas te rgyal po'i khab kyi dmag gi steng du drangs so //

analyzed: de bzhin du lan gnyis lan gsum nas lan lnga'i bar du rgyal po'i khab kyi skye bo mang po rnams kha btag go /

analyzed: mi lnga stong tsam kha btags lags na /
